message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.DB, cs.CL, cs.CR

The paper discusses a logic programming approach for approximate reasoning and information retrieval applications. This falls under the scope of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and logic in computer science (cs.LO). The paper also mentions the use of annotated program clauses and a domain for measuring closeness to user expectations, which suggests a connection to databases (cs.DB) and natural language processing (cs.CL). Finally, the paper discusses the transformation of SQLP(R,D) programs into QLP(D) programs, which could be relevant to cryptography and security (cs.CR).
